sen.j: 明治初年の書生社会の風俗と気質をうつすことを主眼として、下宿生活、牛肉屋、楊弓店などで書生らが遊ぶ様子も描く。
sen.e: The main purpose of this work was to describe the customs, manners and temperaments of student society in 1868, and there are scenes showing the lifestyle of their board and lodgings, and students at play in beef restaurants, yokyu (a small-sized bow originally made from willow) parlors, and elsewhere.

The main purpose of this work was to describe the customs, manners and temperaments of student society in 1868, and there are those scenes depicting the daily lives at their board and lodgings, or students at play in those popular places such as beef specialty restaurants or yokyu (a small-sized bow originally made from willow) parlors.
sen.cmt: 「書生らが遊ぶ様子」内容についての訳部分ですが、文末に「and elsewhere」としてこれら例に挙げたもの以外にも小説に描かれているという意味を示していますが、こういう言い方はあまり英文でしないと思います。「those」などの不特定多数指示代名詞や、「or」など他の要素であることを示す接続しを用いることで対応しています。

sen.j: また、芸妓が筋の中心には上野戦争（彰義隊のたたかい）で生き別れになった兄妹の再会など、通俗的な側面もあった。
sen.e: In addition, there was also an aspect of popular fiction about it, with a geisha (a professional female entertainer at banquets) placed at the center of the storyline, and with such elements as brother and sister being reunited after being separated by the Battle of Ueno (the battle between the shogitai [a band of supporters of the Tokugawa bakufu, Japanese feudal government from the seventeenth to late-nineteenth centuries headed by a shogun] and the Meiji government's army).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処（三文に分割）
sen.e: In addition, there was also an aspect of a popular novel with a geigi (a professional female entertainer at banquets) placed at the center of the storyline, while such element as a reunion of a separated brother and a sister by the Battle of Ueno (the battle between the shogitai [a band of supporters of the Tokugawa bakufu] and the Meiji government's army) was also depicted in the novel.
sen.cmt: 「about it」などは省略して良いものだと思います。その他、多少遠まわしな言い回しを省略、変更しました。芸妓」と「わかれた兄弟」の例は異なる例として、「and」ではなく「while」で接続しました。「being reunited after being separated」という訳文は多少直訳的ですので、「reunion of a separated--」としました。上野戦争や彰義隊、果ては徳川幕府の説明が非常に詳細に含まれていますが、さすがに徳川幕府の説明は削除しました。

sen.e: For that reason, when the author compiled and edited the "Shoyo senshu" (literally, "Shoyo's collection") in his later years, he put all his novels, including this one, together into the 'supplemental volumes'.

sen.j: そのため、作中の〈野々口清作〉なる人物のモデルと誤解されるのを苦にした野口英世が、清作という本名を英世に変えたという、思わぬエピソードも生んだ。
sen.e: This produced an unexpected anecdote, wherein Hideyo NOGUCHI, distressed that people might think that 'Seisaku Nonoguchi', a character in the novel, was modeled after him, changed his real name, Seisaku, to Hideyo.

sen.e: This produced an unexpected anecdote: Hideyo NOGUCHI changed his name from the original Seisaku to Hideyo because he worried that people might misunderstand the character 'Seisaku NONOGUCHI' in this novel was modeled after him.
